title: AI Workshop: Finding ROI
address: 249 N 1200 E, Lehi, UT 84043, USA
description:
Explore how AI can transform business workflows and address inefficiencies in sales, operations, and engineering. This event offers practical insights into identifying bottlenecks, assessing data readiness, and crafting tailored AI solutions for measurable impact.

Why Attend:

    Learn how to map workflows and uncover areas for AI optimization.

    Discover practical AI applications and strategies for implementation.

    Build an actionable roadmap for integrating AI into your organization.

Who Should Attend: This event will be particularly valuable for business and technology leaders who want to understand if AI can help their company hit their target metrics faster or more efficiently.

Join us for a focused workshop on defining AI’s ROI for your company, organization, and team.

title: Utah MLops Meetup | Ai and Geospatial Modeling
address: 1331 W Powell Way, Lehi, UT 84043, USA
description:
When every day counted during the COVID-19 pandemic, data science played an important role in the path to a vaccine. Through sophisticated geospatial modeling, we identified and swiftly mobilized trial recruitment efforts in emerging hot zones. However, the limitations of data science tooling hampered efforts to work collaboratively and quickly. I'll discuss some of the issues we encountered and how our work at Zerve seeks to remedy these issues.

Join us on (slack)[https://theforge.tech]

Schedule:
6:15-6:30 food
6:30 pm announcements
6:45-7:30 speaker
7:30-8:30 announcements

Speaker
Greg Michaelson

Dr. Greg Michaelson is Co-Founder and Chief Product Officer at Zerve, a young, stealthy startup that’s rethinking the data science development experience. Previously, Greg was an early joiner at DataRobot where he played many roles, including Chief Customer Officer. Prior to that, he worked as a data scientist in the financial sector after earning a PhD in applied statistics from the University of Alabama.

Drawing from decades of experience, they'll share actionable strategies for developing clear, compelling copy that resonates with your target audience.

title: Founders Frenzy Pitch Competition -- Sponsored by CFF, Powered by Kickstart
address: 1850 Ashton Blvd Suite 500, Lehi, UT 84043, USA
description:
Founders Frenzy is open to the public, specifically for any students interested in networking with like-minded entrepreneurs and investors. To be eligible to pitch, you MUST be a current student at an Utah university/college or have graduated from college within the past 12 months. 

Pitch presentations will be 5 minutes long, with 3 minutes of Q&A from the Campus Founders Fund investment team.  After the presenters have finished, the investment team will select the top idea to receive a $5,000 investment from Campus Founders Fund. The investment will be in the form of a $5,000 SAFE on very founder-friendly terms ($0 Cap, 0% Discount) and subject to our due diligence process.

If you are interested in pitching your idea at the event, please fill out the submission instructions in the pitch deck template and email your submission to info@campusfounders.com by January 28th at 5 pm.

Pitch deck template: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1nCXjmKOCyv4wQyTLsfQ70hD6-2QElPNIrEk3qyR7ALo/edit?usp=sharing
SAFE: https://www.campusfounders.com/investment
CFF team: https://www.campusfounders.com/team

Note: This event is in Lehi Kiln 2 (NOT in the main theater in  Kiln Lehi). This event is in the beautiful Atrium Space on the 5th floor in the building just southwest of the mare common Kiln Lehi.

title: DevOps in Action: How First-Day Deploys Can Drive Innovation
address: 2600 Ashton Blvd, Lehi, UT 84043, USA
description: Imagine a new engineer deploying code to production on their very first day—even interns. At our company, this isn’t a dream; it’s a tradition. All while completing HR orientation, IT setup, and paperwork during standard working hours. In this session, we’ll dive into the technical investments in CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure, and DevOps practices that make this possible. We’ll also explore the cultural and business benefits of empowering engineers from day one and how this approach drives innovation and customer value.

title: The Growth Toolkit: Scaling Your Business with AI and Virtual Assistants
address: Kiln, 2701 N Thanksgiving Way #100, Lehi, UT 84043, USA
description:
Join us for The Growth Toolkit: Scaling Your Business with AI and Virtual Assistants!

This dynamic session is tailored for entrepreneurs and SMB leaders who want to delegate effectively, simplify workflows, and focus on strategic growth. We’ll dive into real-world examples and offer a step-by-step playbook to help you:

✅Work smarter with skilled Virtual Assistants
✅Leverage AI to streamline processes
✅Free up your time for high-impact activities
✅Achieve growth while cutting costs

Let’s talk about scaling sustainably. See you there!

title: AI Unplugged: Candid Tales from Startup Founders
address: 2701 N Thanksgiving Way #100, Lehi, UT 84043, USA
description:

Founders from Stellar Cyber, Legato Security, and Ridge Security will share stories from their startups, how they are leveraging AI in their respective companies.

Hear firsthand about the opportunities, missteps, and creative strategies redefining entrepreneurship in an AI-powered world.

Happy Hour and Networking followed by a panel discussion at the Kiln in Lehi.

title: How Startups Should Think About Insurance
address: 2701 N Thanksgiving Way #100, Lehi, UT 84043, USA
description:
Join Bob Sargent, Founder and CEO of eSpecialty Insurance, for an informative session about how startup businesses should think about insurance. 

Bob will use his expertise in insurance, technology, and startups to guide you through the strategic considerations involved in securing insurance.

The presentation will cover: 

- The practical realities of what startups face when purchasing insurance
- The critical balance between time constraints, financial resources, and regulatory demands
- Essential coverage needs and external requirements 
- Effective insurance buying strategies
- Real-world examples highlighting the repercussions of inadequate coverage 

The session will conclude with key takeaways on balancing protection, operational needs, and cost considerations in startup environments. Participants can engage in a Q&A session to address specific challenges and explore tailored insurance solutions.

- - - - - - - - - - - -
Bob Sargent, Founder and CEO of eSpecialty Insurance, has years of experience as an underwriter and broker addressing challenging, unique, or complex exposures. He is also a prior founder with multiple exits and an early-stage investor in innovative insurance organizations. Bob serves as a member of, and on the Board, of Park City Angels.

title: Building Excellence: A discussion on building winning products
address: 2701 N Thanksgiving Way #100, Lehi, UT 84043, USA
description: Join us to hear from industry leaders, Paul Draper CTO at Redo, Catherine Wong COO & CPO at Entrata, Lauren Treasure Co-founder & CEO at Stairtop, and Dillon Winspear VP of Product at Awardco on how to create winning products from the development org perspective. Expect a great discussion, fantastic company, and to walk away with a playbook of best practices to implement in your day-to-day processes.

title: Community Builder Breakfast: Why the next era of growth will be community-first
address: 2701 N Thanksgiving Way #100, Lehi, UT 84043, USA
description:
Our hosts:
⛷️ Clint Betts, Founder of Silicon Slopes & CEO.com
🚀 Kyle Spencer, Chief of Staff of Utah Tech Week
⛹🏼‍♂️ Andrew Henker, CRO at Levver & Borderlands
💃🏻 Rae Lambert, Founder of River

With opening welcome remarks from Arian Lewis, CEO & Co-Founder of Kiln

Calling all community builders! Join us a for breakfast tacos & juicy conversations about the next-era growth playbook: community.

The internet, social media, and podcasting all reinvented how companies build their brand. Now, with the rise of generative AI, people are seeking real-world connections more than ever — IRL community will be the next era of growth. 

We'll explore the community playbooks of some of the fastest growing organizations, share what's working well for other community-first companies, why community is so important, and how to leverage real-life connections when building your brand.

Content will be a combination of panel discussion, small group breakouts, and open forum sharing.

title: Beyond SEO - GEO the next wave of being found in the age of AI
address: Utah Valley University, Thanksgiving Point Campus, 2912 Executive Pkwy, Lehi, UT 84043, USA
description:

Say goodbye to slow and outdated SEO methods—GEO offers precision, speed, and results that matter. Find out how this groundbreaking approach leverages AI to connect you with the right customers faster and more effectively than ever before. Usage is projected to grow up to 35% yearly from 2025, potentially leading to a 14% share of the search market by 2028. https://morningscore.io/will-ai-grow-bigger-than-google-search-2020-2028-statistics-and-my-predictions/

title: Lunch & Learn: Vertical AI Panel
address: 2912 Executive Pkwy, Lehi, UT 84043, USA

Our panel of founders will discuss AI's potential to automate manual workflows and increase productivity across different industries like healthcare, finance, and education. title: Disruptors’ Dinner: Guidance to budget, build, and scale with confidence
address: No detailed location available
description:
Have a tech product idea but not sure what to budget or what to do next? Whether you’re an established enterprise or starting something new, join HQ for a private dinner tailored to help you venture confidently into the tech space.

Over the past 12 years, HQ has designed and developed 250+ products for a wide range of clients, including AutoLiv, We Believe Foundation, Delta, Zillow, and numerous Y Combinator startups. We know which questions to ask, the challenges you should anticipate, and how to avoid common pitfalls that may derail new products.

We promise this isn’t a timeshare sales pitch — our goal is to support those creating new products as a way to give back to Utah’s tech community. This is your chance to: 

1. Understand what kind of budget you should anticipate for your product.
2. Learn how to define project requirements.
3. Figure out what to do next, which could range anywhere from further researching your target market to hiring an experienced CTO.
4. Get tips for hiring: Freelancers, agencies, and full-time employees all have their time and place, and we have extensive experience with all of them. We can guide you in the right direction and share some red flags to watch for. 

Spots are limited, so apply now to reserve your seat at the table. Come prepared to ask questions, bounce ideas around, and leave with actionable next steps.

This event is perfect for:

1. Business leaders ready to turn innovative ideas into viable apps or websites.
2. Aspiring tech entrepreneurs with product ideas but no development experience.
3. Founders and startup teams looking to understand the costs and processes behind tech products. 
4. Anyone new to the tech industry looking for insights from experienced professionals.

If you’re interested in building a new product but aren’t sure where to start, this is a must-attend event for Utah Tech Week.

title: Agile Roundtable: Crowd-Sourced Creative Solutions
address: Silicon Slopes, 2600 Executive Pkwy #140, Lehi, UT 84043, USA
description:
Join us in-person at Silicon Slopes in Lehi for the Agile Roundtable as part of Utah Tech Week 2025!

At Agile Roundtables, participants co-create the agenda with the topics they want to discuss. A facilitator guides the team from topic to topic. Then each participant has an opportunity to share what they're taking away from the session. Simple, but powerful!

Agile Roundtables in Utah have been happening monthly since before the Agile Manifesto was written in 2001. Whether you've joined us many times or this is your first, please come! Bring your questions, your challenges, and ideas. You'll walk away from this session not only having gained, but also given something! Even if you don't have a topic in mind, come network and enjoy face-to-face collaboration!

Afternoon refreshments will be provided.

title: K-Connect: A Utah Korean Networking Mixer ( Utah Korean Chamber of Commerce)
address: 3300 Triumph Blvd Suites 100 and 200, Lehi, UT 84043, USA
description:
K-Connect: A Utah Korean Networking Mixer hosted by the Utah Korean Chamber of Commerce

Join us for an evening of connection and collaboration at K-Connect, a networking event designed to bring together Korean students, professionals, business owners, and investors in Utah. Whether you're a budding entrepreneur, an established business leader, or someone looking to engage with the vibrant Korean community, this event is your opportunity to expand your network and spark meaningful relationships.

What to Expect:

Fostering Connections: Meet like-minded individuals, exchange ideas, and explore potential collaborations within the Korean community and beyond.

Showcasing Contributions: Celebrate the achievements of Korean innovators and leaders in Utah’s thriving tech and business ecosystem.

Building Bridges: Create meaningful links between the Korean community and Utah’s broader tech industry to drive mutual growth and success.

Networking Mixer: Enjoy light refreshments, finger foods, and drinks in a relaxed atmosphere perfect for making new connections and deepening existing ones.

Whether you're looking to expand your professional circle, find investment opportunities, or simply enjoy the company of Utah’s dynamic Korean community, K-Connect is the place to be.

title: Raising the Roof: How JobNimbus Went from Bootstrapped to Breaking Records
address: 3451 Triumph Blvd Suite 650, Lehi, UT 84043, USA
description:
Tech founders and CEOs:  Discover how Lehi-based JobNimbus became a game-changing SaaS provider that is reshaping the roofing industry and building one of the most dynamic workplace cultures in the U.S. Since securing its initial investment in 2021, JobNimbus has grown 3x in headcount, significantly expanded its product suite and customer base, and solidified its position as a leader in the roofing software market.

Go behind the scenes of JobNimbus’ growth journey with CEO Ben Hodson to learn what strategies fueled their growth, the challenges they navigated, and how a relentless commitment to turning contractors into heroes drove them to secure an additional $330M growth investment in late 2024.

Tech talent in Utah: Learn about what’s next for JobNimbus and the company’s big hiring plans for 2025.

Agenda:
    11:00 a.m. – Enjoy local bites and tour the coolest workspace in Utah
    11:30 a.m. – Fireside chat and Q&A with Ben Hodson, CEO and co-founder of JobNimbus, and KC Kanoff, Mainsail Partners
    12:30 p.m. – Additional networking and office tours available

title: Utah Burger Club - Utah Tech Week
address: JCW's, 3605 N Thanksgiving Way, Lehi, UT 84043, USA
description:
Utah Burger Club is a community of entrepreneurs, designers, developers, and other friends who come together once a month to enjoy great burgers and each other's company.

Our monthly meetups take place at a different burger joint each time, giving subscribers the opportunity to try new places and discover new favorites. It's a great way to connect with others in the community and reconnect with old friends.

Rules of UBC
💬 Always talk about burger club! #UtahBurgerClub
💵 BYOB - Buy your own burger & tip generously.
💯 Connect with new people. Good vibes only.

FYI, Utah Burger Club is a Substack and can be found here. This way you can easily subscribe, share with friends, and—heaven forbid—unsubscribe.

It's Bingo with a twist for a fun, interactive way to network, problem-solve and get your Swig Fix.

title: Trends in AI Agents and Evals in 2025
address: 1441 W Innovation Way, Lehi, UT 84043, USA
description:
Trends in AI Agents and Evals in 2025
Join us at SchoolAI headquarters for an evening of thought-provoking discussions, networking, and refreshments.

When: January 28th, 2025
Time: 4:30 PM - 6:30 PM
Location: 1441 Innovation Way, Suite 150, Lehi, Utah 84043

Hear from Nate Sanders (CXO, SchoolAI) and Andrew Carr (Chief Scientist, Cartwheel) as they lead a forward-looking conversation on how AI agents and their evaluation frameworks are evolving for 2025 and beyond. Discover the latest breakthroughs shaping everything from virtual assistants to cutting-edge automation, and learn how these innovations are being measured, tested, and refined.

Afterward, enjoy charcuterie and drinks while networking with industry professionals and innovators in a relaxed and engaging atmosphere.

Note: Attendance is limited to 80 guests. RSVP now to secure your spot at this one-of-a-kind event.

title: Perspectives on M&A and Strategic Venture with Adobe
address: No detailed location available
description:
Adobe Ventures, Adobe’s strategic investment arm, is excited to welcome the local Utah tech community for an “Ask Me Anything” style conversation with Adobe leadership during Utah Tech Week. 

Topics will include (but are certainly not limited to!): navigating a partnership with Adobe, innovation at Adobe, and more — we’re especially eager to structure the conversation around your questions for our panel. All confirmed attendees will be invited to submit their questions in advance of the event. 

Please note: this is a limited-capacity event. We will confirm attendance no later than Tuesday, January 28th.

title: Utah Business Founder Friday: Zach Barney of Mobly
address: No detailed location available
description:
Have you ever wondered what it takes to start a successful national brand? Utah Business publishes a weekly founder story on someone from Utah who has built a brand from the ground up. At our monthly Founder Friday events, we bring those stories to life with intimate fireside chats.

At this special Utah Tech Week engagement, we'll sit down with Zach Barney, co-founder and CEO @ Mobly — the platform that is fixing the speed-to-lead problem around in-person events. He’s been building and leading sales team for 15+ years, having spent time at some of the biggest successes in Utah history like Teem and HireVue. Prior to starting Mobly, zach was a drop-in sales operator at a Private Equity firm based in Knoxville, TN. Zach and his wife Erika are going on 16 years of marriage. They have 3 daughters (Lucy 14, Harper 12, Mariah 10), 2 sons (Anders 8, Hayes 5) and 1 puppy, a Bernedoodle named Gus. Zach is incredibly accident prone, and will be celebrating his 40th birthday this year by getting a knee replacement! In spite of his bad knee, Zach is an avid endurance runner and love mountain biking with his wife.

Program
9:00 – 10:00 AM: Registration, Networking & Light Breakfast
10:00 AM: Program Begins
11:00 AM: Event Conclusion

Tickets are free, but are restricted to 140 attendees:
https://www.utahbusiness.com/events/founder-friday-zach-barney-mobly/

title: The Future You Create: Balancing Career Ambitions and Family Joy
address: 211 W Traverse Terrace Dr, Lehi, UT 84043, USA
description:
Balancing kids and customers is a tricky ordeal. Especially when you care deeply about both.

We get it. We're right there with you.

That's why Gabb is excited to partner with Silicon Slopes, Utah Tech Week, and the Experience Design Center (XDC) to host a special community event for parents on Wednesday, January 29th at 7:00 PM at Viewpoint Middle School in Lehi.

The session, entitled "The Future You Create: Balancing Career Ambitions and Family Joy," will feature Sean Donohue, a tenured family and parenting coach who has built a large community on TikTok and Instagram.

Join us as Sean shares insights on how to be more present and intentional with your family, while also finding success at work.

We hope you'll take advantage of this unique opportunity to find more joy and fulfillment at both home and work.

- - - - - 

About the Presenter
Sean Donohue is a globally known Family Coach, founder of www.ParentingModernTeens.comand hosts The Sean Donohue Show Podcast, one of the top parenting podcasts in the world.

A viral social media sensation with videos and teachings enjoyed by tens of millions, Sean has helped countless parents transform their parenting, build strong, healthy homes...and raise amazing adults.

Connect with Sean at www.SaveMyFamily.us

TikTok at  www.TikTok.com/the.family.coach
Instagram at https://instagram.com/the.familycoach
Facebook at www.facebook.com/PMT.Family
YouTube at YouTube.com/c/TheFamilyCoach

title: Dashboard in a Day with Tech-Moms

description: Join us for ‘Dashboard in a Day’ with Tech-Moms at Domo! This hands-on workshop, instructed by Alyson La, will guide you through the essentials of data visualization and dashboard creation using Domo’s powerful tools. You’ll dive into Magic ETL to prepare and transform data, learn visualization techniques to tell compelling data stories, and walk away with a fully interactive dashboard ready to share. Whether you’re new to Domo or looking to sharpen your skills, this workshop provides practical insights and support in an engaging, collaborative environment. Bring your own laptop!

title: Culture Club: Network and Discuss Workplace Culture - Hosted by Awardco

With the theme "Framing the Future of Culture Through Connection," this exclusive event offers dynamic networking, engaging discussions, and a creative atmosphere designed to inspire collaboration and growth. Whether you’re an HR pro, executive, or change-maker, join us to elevate the future of company culture!

title: Open Studio Time with Mustache Power Productions
address: 597 S Pleasant Grove Blvd ste 5, Pleasant Grove, UT 84062, USA
description:
Have a message for your audience that’s been on your mind?  A video that you want made?  A product demo?  Testimonials?  A company Explainer?  

Get it made by a professional free of charge during Utah Tech Week!

We thought and thought about the best class we could teach to help Utah Tech get these videos made, but in the end entrepreneurs shouldn’t spend their time learning to create video.  They should use experts to create them.  So instead of a class we are donating our studio and a technician, setting up time for Utah Tech to come in and make their videos free of charge.  

To sign up for a time and come make your video with our video experts:  

1) Check on the rules and policies here:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1UwgaK4evZlyWrgWv17JI8n-qMsKKhrhJ1CmF9XITkDs/edit?usp=sharing

2) Register for your time at this calendly link: https://calendly.com/clovisl/open-studio.

We only have about 50 slots, so sign up now!

title: How to Enjoy Networking: A Practical Guide to Better Connections
address: 389 S 1300 W St Bldg C2, Pleasant Grove, UT 84062, USA
description:
Hate networking?  You're not alone.  Plenty of people like you endure it (or even avoid it!) because it feels transactional, superficial, and draining.

It doesn't have to feel that way.

To kick off Utah Tech Week, join Vanessa Machin Perez, President of MakeUtah, Aaron Shields, Founder and Executive Director of Mountainside Mentoring, and Cory Ivins, Co-Founder of the Foundry Leadership Program, and discover simple, practical tools to make networking less awkward and more enjoyable. Build meaningful connections with confidence—and then spend the rest of Tech Week practicing - and actually ENJOYING - building your network!

Hosted by MakeUtah and DoTerra.

title: MakeUtah CoWorking Pass
address: 389 S 1300 W St Bldg C2, Pleasant Grove, UT 84062, USA
description:

Stop by our central location near I15 in Pleasant Grove (at the Doterra campus) and enjoy our great wifi, comfortable workspace, and even grab a bite to eat at the cafe downstairs.  Registration is FREE.  Come see for yourself what MakeUtah, a hardtech incubator, is all about!

More details on the space can be found here: 
https://makeutah.org/

Entry Instructions

When you arrive please come to building C at 389 S 1300 W Pleasant Grove. Google Maps will bring you to the correct door.  It will be open (no key-card required).  We are located directly above the cafe, take the elevator or stairs up one floor.  


Parking Instructions

Parking is free - please park in the visitor parking or any unmarked stall.  Additional parking is  available in back (if needed).

description:

    Writing your own customized 100 GRAND PLAN™ in our proprietary workbook

    Connecting with ambitious, heart-centered business owner friends

    Learning specific business action steps that save you time, make you more money, and fit your family lifestyle

We'll talk about MONEY, MOTHERHOOD and what really MATTERS most and how to create more time for what you want, even in uncertain times. 

For example, Clem at ClemSEO increased her revenue by 45% the following month as a result of applying what she learned in this workshop and is on track to generate six figures! 

To join us, $100K+ revenue does not have to be your goal, but fair warning: This workshop helps you see more is possible. Join us, and see what’s possible for you too, Mama.

title: Create Your Own Augmented Reality Experience
address: Riverton, UT, USA
description:
In a short, one-hour workshop, learn how to make your creations pop out into the real world in augmented reality 3D. You'll leave with a working AR experience you can send to your friends or embed in your website.

Topics we'll cover:
• Preparing a 3D model for export as a self-contained AR file in USDZ and GLB formats
• Common problems and how to fix them
• Ensure support for iPhones, Androids, Apple Vision Pro and more
• Publish the final experience to your website

Whether you're a die-hard AR tech nerd, harbor light curiosity, or just want to know what the heck AR is all about, you should find this interesting.

This event is being presented as part of Utah Tech Week. Find other fascinating events to enjoy at https://www.utahtechweek.com

If you wish to follow along, bring your laptop with the latest version of Blender installed. If you have a simple 3D model, bring it too! If not, we’ll point you to free resources. Demo will be done on a Mac, but the process on Windows should be about the same.

See you there!

As a courtesy to other attendees, if you reserve a spot and determine later you're unable to come, please cancel your reservation so someone on the waitlist can fill your seat. Thanks!

title: How to Sell to Large Companies
address: 276 E 12200 S, Draper, UT 84020, USA
description:
For B2B startups, landing large corporate clients is an excellent anchor for revenue as well as demonstration of credibility to their market. At the same time, these are the most complicated customers to land, requiring the startup to identify and build key relationships; navigate the morass of procurement offices, vendor risk reviews, complex stakeholder incentives and approval processes; understand the current internal dynamics of the target client (both as they are and as the client perceives them); negotiate complex contracts and more. It's tough; but it is doable.  

Drew Brown has been through this extensively on both sides of the table. Before recently relocating back to Utah, Drew was the Chief Information Officer for Union Bank and Trust, a $55B bank, managing millions of dollars in technology purchases and negotiations every year. Prior to that, Drew spent ten years advising the CIOs and their peers at publicly traded companies on a host of strategic issues, including many complex technology selection, negotiation, and acquisition projects. On the other side of the table, Drew has built two consulting practices (in AI/ML and technology strategy) and has sold millions of dollars in software and services to large corporate clients. 

Come hear Drew share insights on positioning your product, understanding how these buyers think (and where you can fit in), navigating the corporate mazes, and establishing the credibility that your startup needs to win the deal. Drew will share common tactics he has seen startups use that work, frequently observed mistakes, insights into some of the hard realities, and a few fun anecdotes as well. You can do this, and Drew will help you learn how.

address: 412 W Rivers Edge Dr, Provo, UT 84604, USA
description:
Join RevRoad in partnership with Utah Tech Week and Real AI Dynamics for an exclusive AI Immersion Workshop & Certificate Program designed for founders, executives, and leaders who want to stay ahead in today’s AI-driven world.

Led by Nikky Kho, CEO of Real AI Dynamics, this workshop offers a highly interactive, Harvard Business School-style experience that will transform the way you think about and apply artificial intelligence in your business. Through hands-on activities and real-world scenarios, you'll gain actionable insights into leveraging AI for high-level decision-making and strategic implementation.

This is more than just a workshop—it’s an immersive journey into the practical power of AI. You'll leave equipped to implement AI strategies that drive growth and innovation in your organization.

What you'll gain:
- A clear understanding of AI's transformative potential.
- Practical skills to integrate AI into your business strategy.
- An AI Certificate from the Vjal Institute, a prestigious and accredited university for Artificial Intelligence.

Don't miss this chance to deepen your expertise and lead your company into the future with confidence.

Thursday, Jan 30th | 1-4 PM @ Kiln Provo
Light refreshments & drinks will be served.

Reserve your spot today—seats are limited!

title: Startup Storytelling Contest: The Wild, Wacky, and Bizarre
address: 1555 Freedom Blvd 200 W, Provo, UT 84604, USA
description:
WARNING: This event has absolutely no redeeming qualities.

You will not leave inspired. You won’t learn anything. In fact, attending might make you question your life choices.

What will you gain?
    •    A stomach ache from laughing too hard.
    •    A front-row seat to the most insane startup stories you’ll ever hear.
    •    The bragging rights of saying, “I survived the madness.”

This is THE startup storytelling contest where the unhinged, the unbelievable, and the totally bizarre take center stage. Contestants get 5 minutes to share their true (probably regret-filled) stories, and the audience decides who takes home the glory (and a hilariously bad trophy).

Who needs a TED Talk when you’ve got this circus?

Food? Yeah, we’ve got snacks from the legends at Tech9 to fuel your chaos.

Curious? Of course you are.

Brave enough to step up? Apply to share your story here: https://forms.gle/snWYVNSbYGqS8W6q9

Seats are limited. Regret is infinite.

title: Lifecycle of Utah Technology Company
address: 9690 S 300 W, Sandy, UT 84070, USA
description:
Lifecycle of a Utah Technology Company Event Agenda
Every successful startup journey begins with inspiration, often from the unlikeliest places: a napkin. Entrepreneurs set out on an exciting adventure to turn their visions into reality. But what does it take to navigate the complex landscape of startup growth? How can aspiring founders better understand the different stages of this journey?

Join us for an insightful discussion on the lifecycle of a Utah tech company, hosted by the Utah Innovation Center and The Mill Entrepreneurship Center. Led by Ted McAleer (Park City Angels), is a West Point and United States Army-trained leader with deep expertise in tech startups, this event explores the journey from inspiration to innovation. Learn about Utah's tech ecosystem, available resources, and key strategies for success. Whether you're an aspiring founder or a seasoned entrepreneur, this is your opportunity to gain valuable insights into building and growing a successful tech company. Don’t miss it!

3:00 - Networking
3:15 - Welcome and Introduction - Ted McAleer (Park City Angels) - Utah history and current resources/ecosystem

4:40 Networking

title: New Year, New Dimension in Care
address: 5131 Cottonwood St Building 6, Murray, UT 84107, USA
description:
Kick off the year with an exclusive event hosted by Utah HIMSS in collaboration with Intermountain Health’s Advanced Visualization Engineering Center, led by Rami Shorti, PhD. This one-of-a-kind event invites healthcare professionals, innovators, and the healthcare tech community to gain a sneak peek into how technology is advancing patient outcomes and the intrapreneurial journey that made it possible within Intermountain Health.

Discover how advanced tools like 3D visualization, immersive simulations, and 3D-printed surgical models are addressing real-world clinical challenges and creating new applications for technology in healthcare. The event will highlight the intersection of entrepreneurship, medicine, engineering, and art, showcasing creative and technical innovations shaping the future of care.

Learn how a leading healthcare system fosters a spirit of startup, turning exploration and opportunity into impactful solutions that improve outcomes and reduce costs. Start the year inspired by the art of the possible, connect with thought leaders, and experience how innovative approaches and applications of technology are advancing healthcare. 

Event Highlights:
An Intrapreneur’s Journey in a Leading Healthcare System: Much like a startup, discover how an entrepreneur’s passion was embraced at Intermountain Health, paving the way for the transformation of ideas and technologies into impactful solutions for patient care. Learn firsthand about the journey, mindset, and leadership approach that nurtured this innovation.

Demonstrations of 3D and Immersive Technology Applications: Explore live examples of 3D engineering design, 3D printing, and mixed reality. See how these tools empower caregivers to deliver exceptional care, improve patient outcomes, and reduce costs across various healthcare settings.

Interactive Q&A Session: Engage directly with Rami Shorti, PhD, and a member of his team to gain insights into the development and integration of these technologies at Intermountain Health.

Lunch will be provided.

title: ADHDers Anonymous
address: 3495 S W Temple St, South Salt Lake, UT 84115, USA
description:
Join us for an informal and supportive gathering of Utah’s ADHD tech community! This space allows us to share experiences, swap tips for thriving in tech with ADHD, and celebrate the creative energy that makes us stand out.

Whether you’re a founder, executive, developer, product manager, designer, or just a tech nerd who loves innovation, you’ll find like-minded people who “get it.” Expect good vibes, engaging conversations, and the chance to build connections with others who embrace their neurodiversity.

Let’s support each other, share our wins (and struggles), and brainstorm how to harness our ADHD superpowers to thrive in the fast-paced world of tech. Snacks provided. Ideas welcome. Distractions encouraged.

title: Empathy in Action: Design Thinking for Real-World Success
address: 650 S Main St Suite 745, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
description:
Join us at our Slalom Consulting Salt Lake City office to learn how practical design thinking and human-centered design can address your biggest startup challenges, helping you scale effectively and connect deeply with customers. 

Join this interactive session to explore the power of design thinking and human-centered design. You’ll learn practical tools and techniques to:
 -align your team, 
 -improve customer experiences, and 
 -create solutions that resonate with users. 

Expect a mix of insights, activities, and actionable takeaways to drive real-world impact.

Light refreshments and snacks will be served. 

Building and Parking Information: 
Slalom Salt Lake City is located at 650 S Main Street, SLC, UT, 84101.
 
Please note that W 600 S is a one way Eastbound and Trax is on Main Street. It’s advised to arrive on W 600 S coming from the West.
 
Parking is available free of charge in the covered parking garage directly west of the building. If no spots are available on the first floor, proceed up to the additional floors. All gates will be up and you will not need a ticket or fob to access the parking. Please be mindful of reserved spots.

After parking, please take the elevator or stairs down to the first floor of the parking garage. Then walk under the covered walkway/through the courtyard to enter the building. You will then see the event location.

title: The Business of Design: Debunking Myths That Hold Startups Back
address: 650 S Main St Suite 745, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
description:
Join us at our Slalom Consulting Salt Lake Office where we will uncover the truth behind common design myths and learn how to make design a powerful tool for your startup’s success.

In this workshop, we’ll address three common misconceptions about design: that it requires a large team, is only about aesthetics, and only applies to products. Through real-life examples and actionable tools, you’ll discover how design:
 -can uncover opportunities, 
 -streamline workflows, and 
 -enhance customer experiences. 

Expect to leave with practical strategies to integrate design into your business, no matter your team size or resources. 

Light refreshments and snacks will be served. 

Building and Parking Information: 
Slalom Salt Lake City is located at 650 S Main Street, SLC, UT, 84101.
 
Please note that W 600 S is a one way Eastbound and Trax is on Main Street. It’s advised to arrive on W 600 S coming from the West.
 
Parking is available free of charge in the covered parking garage directly west of the building. If no spots are available on the first floor, proceed up to the additional floors. All gates will be up and you will not need a ticket or fob to access the parking. Please be mindful of reserved spots.

After parking, please take the elevator or stairs down to the first floor of the parking garage. Then walk under the covered walkway/through the courtyard to enter the building. You will then see the event location.

title: Executive Panel Discussion: Innovation, AI, and The Future of Technology
address: 650 S Main St Suite 745, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
description:
This event will include breakfast, an executive panel discussion, interactive exhibits, and numerous networking opportunities. Don’t miss this opportunity to experience and explore what’s possible! 

Panelist:
Jennifer Smith | EVP and Chief Technology & Operations Officer, Zions Bancorporation
 As a key member of the company's C-Suite, she leads transformative technology and operations initiatives on an enterprise scale, ensuring long-term value for customers. Jennifer is known for her courageous and compassionate leadership, fostering environments of empowerment, performance, and belonging. 
Jennifer joined Zions in 2006 as the Chief Audit Executive after a successful tenure at Wells Fargo & Company from 1995 to 2006, where she held senior positions in Internal Audit and Risk Management. She holds an honors B.A. and an M.S. in Economics from the University of Utah. 
Jennifer’s work has been widely recognized by industry organizations. In 2023, she received the Outstanding Leadership Award for Social and Business Innovation from the YWCA of Utah. Jennifer has been named one of American Banker’s Most Powerful Women in Banking for four consecutive years (2021-2024). She also received the Women Tech Council’s Decade of Impact Award in 2024 and their Technology Leadership Award in 2018. In 2019, she was honored as one of Utah Business’s CxOs of the Year. 
Jennifer is deeply committed to community service. She is a current member of the Women Leadership Institute’s and The Children’s Center of Utah’s Board of Directors. She formerly chaired the University of Utah’s College of Social and Behavioral Science Advancement Board and served on Utah State University’s Data Analytics and Information Systems advisory board. Additionally, she has held positions on the boards of the YWCA of Utah, United Way of Greater Salt Lake, and People Helping People.
---------------------------------------------
Cyd Tetro | Chief Information Officer, Swire Coca-Cola
Cydni Tetro is the CIO at Swire Coca-Cola, one of the largest bottlers in the world, where she leads AI, Data, Digital, and Technology initiatives and drives transformative changes. She is an accomplished 3X CEO with over a decade of experience driving profitable growth and delivering exceptional P&L performance across diverse industries. As the 2023 EY Entrepreneur of the Year, she is recognized as a visionary leader in consumer products and a nationally renowned technology innovator. Cydni has consistently paved the way for women in business and technology while generating record-breaking fundraising results.
Prior, as CEO and Board Member of CPG Tech-enabled Brandless, she propelled the company’s growth by 400%, adding over $100 million in revenue through strategic acquisitions and organic expansion in 18 months. Her leadership at ForgeDX, a digital transformation platform, and 3DplusMe, a CPG 3D printing company, resulted in multi-million-dollar partnerships with global brands and led to successful acquisitions of both companies. Cydni drove digital innovation and technology commercialization in her role as at Disney Imagineering. And her earlier career includes executive roles in high-growth technology companies, driving scale and growth that impacted hundreds of millions of users.
A passionate advocate for women in technology, Cydni founded the Women Tech Council to increase women in tech from high school to the board room, which has inspired over 40,000 young women to pursue STEM careers through the SheTech program. Her academic contributions include teaching at Babson University and BYU. Cydni holds a master’s degree in business administration and a bachelor’s degree in computer science and is the recipient of numerous awards, including Most Influential Women, CEO of the Year and Innovator of the Year.

title: Humanizing Tech: Belonging as the Key to Success: A Workshop + Networking Event
address: 650 S Main St #150, Salt Lake City, UT 84101, USA
description:
Culture First Salt Lake City is coming back!  Join us for our relaunch event taking place during Utah Tech Week.  This session starts with an interactive workshop focusing on fostering belonging in the workplace—an essential element for thriving teams, especially in the dynamic Utah tech community. 

Following the workshop, we'll have time to network and enjoy some drinks and appetizers.  We know networking and even connecting with others can feel awkward—like standing in an elevator and not knowing where to look, especially if small talk isn’t your strong suit. So we've brought in an expert in networking, connection, and belonging, Bahaa Chmait.  As a trained facilitator, he’s passionate about helping people step off the awkward elevator and into meaningful connection!  



What to expect: 

* Belonging Badge Workshop: A guided exercise where participants create and explore personal "badges" to communicate and represent their identities and values. Learn how to facilitate this activity in your workplace to deepen connections and inspire inclusion.

* Networking and Social Hour: Build relationships with like-minded leaders in tech, start-ups, and the people space.

Who should attend:

* This event is open to anyone in the Utah tech community and anyone who cares about the human experience in the workplace.

Date: January 30, 2025

Time:

* Workshop: 4:00–5:00 PM - Part 1: Belonging Badges Workshop / Part 2: Learn how to facilitate Belonging Badges for your team or workplace

* Networking & Social Hour: 5:00–6:00 PM 

Location: 

* Belonging Workshop @ Common Desk, 650 S Main St #150, Salt Lake City, UT 84101

* Networking: Sol Agave, 660 S Main St, Salt Lake City, UT 84101 (across the parking lot from Common Desk)

Facilitated by: Bahaa Chmait, Founder of Joymob Events, BahaaChmait.com  

Hosted by: Carrie Williams & The Salt Lake City chapter of Culture First

Why This Matters:

Utah's tech sector is booming, making collaboration, creativity, and community essential to success. A sense of belonging drives connection, enhances job satisfaction, and retains top talent—critical for startups and established companies alike. Belonging Badges help uncover the shared stories and unique identities that bring teams together and build psychological safety.  Teams that prioritize belonging and inclusivity experience a 25% boost in performance and 36% higher retention rates. Activities like Belonging Badges promote authentic connections, inclusivity, and team cohesion, fostering an environment where employees feel seen, valued, and engaged—key drivers of success in the fast-paced tech world.

About Culture First:

Culture First is a global community of professionals dedicated to creating better workplaces. Guided by the belief that a strong, inclusive culture drives business outcomes, we empower companies to prioritize employee experience and human connection.

Get Involved:

Spaces are limited! Reserve your spot now and join us in celebrating the power of belonging and culture in the workplace.

title: Breakfast Palooza "Vitality"
address: 2601 Sunnyside Ave S, Salt Lake City, UT 84108, USA
description:
Join us for Breakfast Palooza "Vitality," presented by East West Health—an unparalleled day dedicated to personal growth, professional development, and vibrant health. Set amidst the picturesque Garden Place at Heritage Park, this exclusive event will gather high-performing investors and entrepreneurs ready to energize their lives and businesses.

Starting at 9 a.m., you’ll indulge in our Breakfast Palooza signature pancakes, topped with the finest Northern Eagle maple syrup, while enjoying uplifting music and an extraordinary networking environment that will set the tone for a day of inspiration and connection.

Event Highlights:

    Health Performance & Goal-Setting Workshop: Kickstart your day with actionable insights to elevate your vitality and productivity. This interactive session will help you build a roadmap to achieve your personal and professional health goals.

    Business Growth Panel Discussion: Learn strategies for sustainable growth from industry leaders who’ll guide you in setting impactful goals for the upcoming year. Get inspired, ask questions, and take away actionable advice to fuel your business success.

    Dynamic Guest Speakers: Be inspired by a lineup of speakers who will challenge and empower you to push the boundaries of what's possible, fueling both your personal and business growth journey.

In alignment with our commitment to giving back, we’re proud to partner with a dedicated non-profit organization to raise funds and awareness for their impactful cause. This partnership provides an opportunity for attendees to contribute to a meaningful initiative while connecting with like-minded individuals passionate about making a difference.

Breakfast Palooza "Vitality" runs until 6 p.m.—a full day to recharge, refocus, and realign with what matters most. This is more than a conference; it’s a transformative experience designed to help you live a fuller, more purpose-driven life. Don’t miss out on this opportunity to network, learn, and grow with a vibrant community of trailblazers.

Who Should Attend?

Entrepreneurs, investors, and business leaders who are ready to:

    Expand their networks with driven, high-achieving peers

    Gain insights into business and personal growth strategies for the coming year

    Support a noble cause that impacts lives and communities

title: Future Space: Because Your Office Deserves to Be as Cool as You Are
address: 515 S 700 E, Salt Lake City, UT 84102, USA
description:
Food- We’ll have your 2pm pick me up!

Join the Future Space Club—it’s cooler than your current office. Want to keep your top talent and attract even more? We’ll show you how your office space could be making or breaking your talent retention.

From branding to culture and a work environment that fuels productivity, we'll dive into how your space directly impacts employee retention. Let’s make your HQ a place people never want to leave.

title: Shop Workspace Pass: Utah Tech Week 2025
address: 350 E 400 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
description:
The Shop Workspace is a proud partner of Utah Tech Week. During the week, enjoy complimentary day passes during our business hours, Monday-Friday 8:30am-5:00pm. Head to reception on the 3rd floor, let the team know you are a part of Utah Tech Week, and enjoy the day on us. 

A day pass will include access to 2 floors of open coworking, private phone booths, and our beverage bar of espresso, drip coffee, soda, and tea. 

Learn more about our space here: https://shopworkspace.com/location/salt-lake-city/.

Instructions to get to us

We are located at 350 E 400 S on a side street called Blair. There will be a Shop Workspace A Frame and logo on our door. Once in the lobby, head to the 3rd floor and a member of our team will help at reception.

Parking
There is street parking along 500 S, 300 E, and 400E, as well as paid parking at the public library up the street.

title: The Growth Toolkit: Scaling Your Business with EOS
address: 350 E 400 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
description:
A dynamic "Lunch and Learn" workshop designed for entrepreneurs, business owners, and growth companies looking to scale.  Even the most successful entrepreneurs occasionally find running a business more challenging than expected. Most business owners are regularly frustrated by one or more common issues: 
lack of control,  people issues, or inability to reach the next level. 

Led by Professional EOS Implementer® John Annunziata, this event will help you:
● Understand the six keys to building a truly great organization
● Learn how to get everyone focused on achieving a clear company vision
● Begin to instill discipline and accountability throughout the organization
● Roll up your sleeves and confront organizational issues head-on
● Strengthen and grow your business with powerful results

title: Tech Tune-Up: Essentials for Small Business Efficiency
address: The Shop Co-Working, 350 E 400 S, Salt Lake City, UT 84111, USA
description:
Part of Utah Tech Week 2025

Is your business lagging behind because you don't have the right technical solutions in place? Join us on January 29, from 3 PM to 5 PM at The Shop Coworking Space in downtown Salt Lake City for a powerful workshop designed just for small business owners like you.

Running a small business is no small task. From keeping up with daily operations to planning for growth, it’s easy to feel overwhelmed by all the tools and technology out there. How do you know what your business really needs? And how do you make sure those tools are working for you, not against you?

At the Small Biz Tech Workshop, we’ll walk you through:
-Understanding your business processes: What’s working, what’s not, and where technology can help.
-Building your tech stack: Discover the best tools to streamline your operations and support your growth.
-Exploring automation options: Learn how to save time and money by automating repetitive tasks.

Our expert speakers will guide you every step of the way:
-Jordan Smith, Owner of Ronin Consulting LLC, will show you how to define and scale your business processes.
-Chris Hess, Owner of Tech Op Heroes, will help you evaluate technical solutions to improve your operations.
-Sunny Washington, CEO of OrcaPanda, will share how AI and other tools can boost your marketing and lead generation efforts.

This event is perfect for small business owners, solo entrepreneurs, and anyone ready to improve their operations and stay ahead in today’s tech-driven world.

The best part? This event is FREE! Don’t miss this chance to work with professionals who can help you achieve your business goals.

Spots are limited, so sign up now to reserve your seat! 

Let’s turn your business challenges into opportunities. See you on January 29!

title: Utah Tech Brunch: Visionaries + VCs
address: Salt Lake City, UT, USA
description:

Swing by and grab a bite to eat while networking with the investors, founders, and executives that make Utah a thriving tech ecosystem. We can't wait to see you there!
